original: ji lta zhe na /

original: gzugs dang gzugs med las skyes pa'i //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med las skyes pa'i //

original: 'dod chags gnyis rgod nga rgyal rmongs //
analyzed: 'dod chags gnyis rgod nga rgyal rmongs //
translated: Attachment, hostility, conceit, pride, and ignorance.

analyzed: zhes te / 'di dag gi kun du sbyor ba gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga yin te /
translated: These are the five higher fetters.

analyzed: 'di lta ste gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ste /
translated: They are attachment to the form realm, attachment to the formless realm, conceit, pride, and ignorance.

original: de dag ma spangs par khams gong ma las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ma spangs par khams gong ma las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not transcend the higher realms without abandoning them.

original: kun du sbyor ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the fetters is completed.

original: // / 'ching ba rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / 'ching ba rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the bonds?

original: 'ching ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'ching ba ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three bonds:

analyzed: 'ching ba 'dod chags thams cad dang / 'ching ba zhe sdang dang / gti mug thams cad do //
translated: the bond of attachment, the bond of hostility, and the bond of conceit.

original: ci'i phyir gsum po ni 'ching bar bshad ce na /🔽tshor ba'i dbang gis 'ching ba gsum //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gsum po ni 'ching bar bshad ce na / tshor ba'i dbang gis 'ching ba gsum //
translated: Why are these three explained as bonds?🔽The three bonds are due to the three feelings.

original: tshor ba gsum gyi dbang gis 'ching ba gsum ste /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum gyi dbang gis 'ching ba gsum ste /
translated: The three bonds are due to the three feelings.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur la /
translated: Attachment increases through the power of the object-field and the power of association with regard to the sensation of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal la ni zhe sdang ngo //🔽bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni gti mug ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ni zhe sdang ngo // bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni gti mug ste /
translated: Aversion increases with regard to the sensation of displeasure.🔽Error increases with regard to the sensation that is neither pleasurable nor painful.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dag ni de lta ma yin @250a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dag ni de lta ma yin @250a * //
translated: Attachment and aversion do not increase with regard to the sensation that is neither pleasurable nor painful.

original: no ; / yang na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin no //
analyzed: no ; / yang na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin no //
translated: Or else, they increase with regard to the sensation that is present in one’s own mental stream.

original: phra rgyas rnams ni sngar bshad pa kho nar zad do //
analyzed: phra rgyas rnams ni sngar bshad pa kho nar zad do //
translated: The proclivities have already been explained.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams brjod par bya ste /🔽de la re zhig gang dag nyon mongs pa yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams brjod par bya ste / de la re zhig gang dag nyon mongs pa yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin te /
translated: The secondary defilements should now be explained.🔽All defilements are secondary defilements, because they defile the mind.

original: sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽nyon mongs las gzhan nyon mongs can //
analyzed: sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro // nyon mongs las gzhan nyon mongs can //
translated: The other mental factors that are defiled, and the formations dissociated from the mind, are also secondary defilements.

original: sems byung 'du byed phung zhes bya //🔽gang de'ang nye ba'i nyon mongs te //
analyzed: sems byung 'du byed phung zhes bya //🔽gang de'ang nye ba'i nyon mongs te //
translated: The other mental factors that are defiled, and the formations dissociated from the mind, are also secondary defilements.

original: de dag nyon mongs zhes mi bya //
analyzed: de dag nyon mongs zhes mi bya //
translated: They are not called afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams las gzhan pa chos nyon mongs pa can sems las byung ba 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams las gzhan pa chos nyon mongs pa can sems las byung ba 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Those that are afflicted dharmas other than the afflictions, which are included in the aggregate of formation, are only secondary afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not afflictions.

original: de dag kyang gzhi phran tshegs las byung ba gang dag yin ba'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhi phran tshegs las byung ba gang dag yin ba'o //
translated: They are those that arise in the Kṣudraka Collection.

original: 'dir ni kun nas dkris pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri mas bsdus pa kho na bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni kun nas dkris pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i dri mas bsdus pa kho na bstan par bya ste /
translated: Here, only those included in the entanglements and the stains of the afflictions will be explained.

original: kun nas dkris pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the entanglements?

original: smras pa nyon mongs pa yang kun nas dkris pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa nyon mongs pa yang kun nas dkris pa yin te /
translated: It is said: Afflictions are also entanglements.

original: mdo las / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa sdug bsngal gyi rkyen zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa sdug bsngal gyi rkyen zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: A sutra states: The condition of suffering is the entanglement of desire realm attachment.

original: bstan bcos rab tu byed pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rab tu byed pa las ni /
translated: But the treatise Prajñaptibhāṣya explains:

original: ngo tsha med dang khrel med dang // phrag dog ser sna rgod pa dang // 'gyod dang rmugs dang gnyid dang ni //
analyzed: ngo tsha med dang khrel med dang // phrag dog ser sna rgod pa dang // 'gyod dang rmugs dang gnyid dang ni //
translated: Shamelessness, absence of conscience, jealousy, avarice, excitedness, regret, torpor, and sleep,

original: kun nas dkris pa rnam pa brgyad //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa rnam pa brgyad //
translated: are the eight envelopers.

original: 'byung ngo // bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs kyis ni kun nas dkris pa bcu ste /
analyzed: 'byung ngo // bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs kyis ni kun nas dkris pa bcu ste /
translated: According to the Vaibhāṣikas, there are ten envelopers:

original: brgyad po de dag dang / khro dang 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad po de dag dang / khro dang 'chab pa'o //
translated: the eight mentioned above, plus anger and concealment.

original: de la ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Shamelessness and absence of conscience have already been explained.

original: phrag dog ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: phrag dog ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o //
translated: Jealousy is an irritation of mind with regard to another's qualities or goods.

original: ser sna ni chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can sems kyis kun nas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna ni chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa rab tu sbyin pa dang 'gal ba can sems kyis kun nas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Avarice is a grasping of the mind which is opposed to generosity and to the giving of teachings, goods, and knowledge.

original: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba'o //
translated: Excitedness is a non-calmness of mind.

original: 'gyod pa dang rmugs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang rmugs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Regret and torpor have already been explained.

original: gnyid ni lus yang dag par 'dzin par mi nus pa sems mngon par sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid ni lus yang dag par 'dzin par mi nus pa sems mngon par sdud pa'o //
translated: Sleep is a contraction of the mind which is incapable of controlling the body.

original: de dang 'gyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'gyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin no //
translated: Regret and envy are only defilements.

original: khro ba ni gnod sems dang / rnam par @250b 'tshe ba ma gtogs pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba ni gnod sems dang / rnam par @250b 'tshe ba ma gtogs pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Anger is the irritation of the mind with regard to sentient beings and non-sentient things, except for hatred and malice.

original: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'o //
analyzed: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'o //
translated: Concealment is the hiding of one's faults.

original: kun nas dkris pa de rnams las //🔽'dod chags dang / ngo tsha med rgod ser sna bslang //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa de rnams las // 'dod chags dang / ngo tsha med rgod ser sna bslang //
translated: These are the ten envelopments.🔽Three envelopments are the outflow of craving.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum po 'di dag ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum po 'di dag ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa yin no //
translated: Three envelopments are the outflow of craving: languor, restlessness and torpor.

original: 'chab pa rtsod do //🔽kha cig na re /
analyzed: 'chab pa rtsod do // kha cig na re /
translated: Concealment is disputed.

original: sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is the outflow of craving.

original: gzhan dag na re ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o zhes zer ro //🔽gzhan dag na re de gnyi ga'i yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o zhes zer ro // gzhan dag na re de gnyi ga'i yin te /
translated: Others say that it is the outflow of ignorance.

original: go rims bzhin du shes pa dang mi shes pa rnams kyi yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du shes pa dang mi shes pa rnams kyi yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is the outflow of both, because it is associated with both.

original: ma rig pa las /
analyzed: ma rig pa las /
translated: From ignorance,

original: rmugs dang gnyid dang khrel med do //
analyzed: rmugs dang gnyid dang khrel med do //
translated: torpor, sleep, and lack of conscience.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin no //
translated: These three are the natural outcome of ignorance.

original: the tshom las 'gyod khro ba dang / phrag dog khong khro'i rgyu las byung //
analyzed: the tshom las 'gyod khro ba dang / phrag dog khong khro'i rgyu las byung //
translated: Regret, envy, and avarice arise from doubt, anger, and the roots.

original: khong khro bas kun nas bslang ba dag yin te /
analyzed: khong khro bas kun nas bslang ba dag yin te /
translated: They are aroused by anger.

original: de ltar na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa dag yin no //
translated: Thus these ten secondary defilements are the natural outcome of the defilements.

original: gzhan yang nyon mongs dri ma drug /'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon mongs dri ma drug /'di lta ste /
translated: There are six other defilements:

original: sgyu dang g-yo dang rgyags pa dang // de bzhin 'tshig dang khon 'dzin dang // rnam 'tshe /
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo dang rgyags pa dang // de bzhin 'tshig dang khon 'dzin dang // rnam 'tshe /
translated: deceit, dissimulation, pride, anger, concealment, and jealousy.

original: de la sgyu ni gzhan 'drid pa'o //
analyzed: de la sgyu ni gzhan 'drid pa'o //
translated: Among them, deceit is the concealing of one's faults.

original: g-yo ni sems gya gyu ba ste /
analyzed: g-yo ni sems gya gyu ba ste /
translated: Dissimulation is the crookedness of mind.

original: gang gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi 'chags gyi  gtam rlung bskur ba 'am mi gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi 'chags gyi  gtam rlung bskur ba 'am mi gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: By it one does not confess one's faults as they are in reality, but makes excuses or does not understand the question.

original: rgyags pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyags pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Pride has already been explained.

original: 'tshig pa ni kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa'i dngos po dam du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'tshig pa ni kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa'i dngos po dam du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Spite is the firm grasping of an object that is blameworthy.

original: gang gis rig par gtams pa mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis rig par gtams pa mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the inability to bear the good qualities of others.

original: khon du 'dzin pa ni kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po lan mang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa ni kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po lan mang du byed pa'o //
translated: Resentment is the frequent occurrence of the basis of malice.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni rnam par tho 'tshams pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni rnam par tho 'tshams pa ste /
translated: Harmfulness is the desire to harm.

original: gang gis mtshon cha dang tshig rtsub po dag gis pha rol po rnam par tho 'tshams par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma drug po de dag las /
analyzed: gang gis mtshon cha dang tshig rtsub po dag gis pha rol po rnam par tho 'tshams par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma drug po de dag las /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba na gang las spang bar bya zhe na /

original: dmigs pa las nyon mongs pa ni spang bar byar 'dod /
analyzed: dmigs pa las nyon mongs pa ni spang bar byar 'dod /
translated: It is asserted that defilements are abandoned from their objects.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa las ni nyon mongs par rnam par dbye bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa las ni nyon mongs par rnam par dbye bar mi nus so //
translated: They cannot be separated from their concomitants.

original: dmigs pa las ni nus te /
analyzed: dmigs pa las ni nus te /
translated: They can be separated from their objects.

original: 'di ltar yang de la dmigs nas mi skyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang de la dmigs nas mi skyi'o //
translated: In the same way, one does not delight in the object of consciousness when one has understood the object of consciousness.

original: re zhig ma 'ongs pa ni dmigs pa las rnam par da bye bar yang nus grang na 'das pa go ji ltar nus /
analyzed: re zhig ma 'ongs pa ni dmigs pa las rnam par da bye bar yang nus grang na 'das pa go ji ltar nus /
translated: One can understand that the future is distinguished from the object, but how can one understand that the past is distinguished from the object?

original: 'on te 'di'i don ni dmigs pa yongs su shes pas spang bar bya ba 'di yin no zhe na de yang ma nges te /
analyzed: 'on te 'di'i don ni dmigs pa yongs su shes pas spang bar bya ba 'di yin no zhe na de yang ma nges te /
translated: If you say that the meaning of the Sūtra is that the object of consciousness is abandoned by the complete knowledge of the object, this is not certain.

original: de lta bas na 'di brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Thus, you must explain the meaning of the Sūtra.🔽By what is the abandonment of the defilements characterized?

original: ji tsam gyis na nyon mongs pa spangs pa zhes brjod ce na rang gi rgyud la yod pa ni thob pa chad pas so ;
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na nyon mongs pa spangs pa zhes brjod ce na rang gi rgyud la yod pa ni thob pa chad pas so ;
translated: When the defilements exist in the life-stream, their abandonment is characterized by the cutting off of the possession of the defilements.🔽When the defilements do not exist in the life-stream, their abandonment is characterized by the non-arising of the possession of the defilements.🔽When the defilements exist in the life-stream of another, their abandonment is characterized by the abandonment of the defilements which have for their object the wholesome and unobscured non-defined factors of the life-stream of another.

original: / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / gzugs med pa thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos ni de dag la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rang gi rgyud la yod pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / gzugs med pa thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos ni de dag la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rang gi rgyud la yod pa spangs pa'o //
translated: When the defilements exist in the life-stream of another, their abandonment is characterized by the abandonment of the defilements which have for their object all the factors of the realm of immateriality and the non-defiled factors.

original: thag bsring ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba thag bsring ba'i ngo bo rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: thag bsring ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba thag bsring ba'i ngo bo rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: What is the nature of remoteness?

original: thag bsring ba'i ngo bo ni rnam pa bzhi yod do zhes grag ste /🔽mtshan nyid mi mthun mi mthun phyogs //
analyzed: thag bsring ba'i ngo bo ni rnam pa bzhi yod do zhes grag ste / mtshan nyid mi mthun mi mthun phyogs //
translated: It is said that there are four types of distance:🔽1. distance by incompatibility,🔽2. distance by separation,

original: yul rnams chad dang dus kyis te //🔽'byung dang tshul khrims phyogs dang ni //
analyzed: yul rnams chad dang dus kyis te // 'byung dang tshul khrims phyogs dang ni //
translated: 3. distance by category,

original: dus gnyis ring ba nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dus gnyis ring ba nyid lta bu'o //
translated: and 4. distance by time.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ring ba nyid ni dper na 'byung ba chen po rnams lhan cig skyes pa yin yang mtshan nyid mi mthun pas ring ba nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ring ba nyid ni dper na 'byung ba chen po rnams lhan cig skyes pa yin yang mtshan nyid mi mthun pas ring ba nyid lta bu'o //
translated: Distance by incompatibility is, for example, the distance of the great elements, which are coexistent but incompatible.

original: gnyen pos ring ba nyid ni dper na 'chal pa'i tshul khrims las tshul khrims lta bu'o //🔽yul gyis ring ba nyid ni dper na bskal pa'i yul rnam par @255a * //🔽chad pas te /
analyzed: gnyen pos ring ba nyid ni dper na 'chal pa'i tshul khrims las tshul khrims lta bu'o // yul gyis ring ba nyid ni dper na bskal pa'i yul rnam par @255a * // chad pas te /
translated: Distance by antidote is, for example, the distance of morality from immorality.

original: shar dang nub kyi rgya mtsho bzhin no //
analyzed: shar dang nub kyi rgya mtsho bzhin no //
translated: Distance by separation is, for example, the distance of the eastern ocean from the western ocean, due to the separation of the continents.

original: dus kyis ring ba nyid ni dper na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa lta bu'o //🔽ring ba zhes bya ba de gang las ring ba yin /
analyzed: dus kyis ring ba nyid ni dper na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa lta bu'o // ring ba zhes bya ba de gang las ring ba yin /
translated: Distance by time is, for example, the distance of the past and future.🔽What is meant by distance?

original: de ltar las so //
analyzed: de ltar las so //
translated: It is that from which there is distance.

original: 'das ma thag pa dang / skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ji ltar na ring ba yin /
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa dang / skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ji ltar na ring ba yin /
translated: How can the immediately past and the immediately future be distant?

original: de ni dus tha dad pa nyid kyis ring ba yin gyi yun ring mo zhig na byung ba dang / 'byung ba nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni dus tha dad pa nyid kyis ring ba yin gyi yun ring mo zhig na byung ba dang / 'byung ba nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: They are distant because they are separated by a different time period, not because they are separated by a long period of time.

original: de ltar yang de bzhin du ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang de bzhin du ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the past and future are distant in relation to the present.

original: 'o na ni byed pas ring ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni byed pas ring ba nyid yin no //
translated: But they are distant because they are not presently effective.

original: 'dus ma byas ji ltar na nye ba nyid du 'grub /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ji ltar na nye ba nyid du 'grub /
translated: How can unconditioned things be near?

original: de thams cad du thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thams cad du thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are obtained everywhere.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But the same argument applies to the past and future.

original: nam mkha' yang ji ltar nye ba yin /🔽de lta na 'o na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni da ltar gyis chod pa'i phyir phan tshun du ring ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' yang ji ltar nye ba yin / de lta na 'o na ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni da ltar gyis chod pa'i phyir phan tshun du ring ba nyid yin no //
translated: And how can space be near?🔽In that case, the past and future are distant from each other because the present intervenes.

original: de ltar ni gnyi ga dang nye ba'i phyir nye ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar ni gnyi ga dang nye ba'i phyir nye ba yin la /
translated: But they are near because they are near to both the present and the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang chod pa med pa'i phyir nye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang chod pa med pa'i phyir nye ba yin no //
translated: And the unconditioned is near because it is not separated by anything.

original: de lta na yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang nye ba'i phyir gnyi gar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang nye ba'i phyir gnyi gar 'gyur ro //
translated: But they are both distant and near, because they are related to the past, future and present.

original: 'di skad du ma 'ongs pa ni ma thob pa'i phyir chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid las ring ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di skad du ma 'ongs pa ni ma thob pa'i phyir chos kyi rang gi mtshan nyid las ring ba yin la /
translated: It would be reasonable to say that the future is distant from the intrinsic nature of the factors because it has not yet been acquired,

original: 'das pa ni zhig pa'i phyir ring ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa ni zhig pa'i phyir ring ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that the past is distant because it has perished.

original: ci lam khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi spangs pa yang dang yang du khyad par du 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci lam khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi spangs pa yang dang yang du khyad par du 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Is the abandonment of the defilements also repeated because of the progress of the path?

original: de ni med de nyon mongs pa thams cad ni lan cig tu zad /🔽gang gi spong ba'i lam gang yin pa de kho nas de zad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni med de nyon mongs pa thams cad ni lan cig tu zad / gang gi spong ba'i lam gang yin pa de kho nas de zad pa yin no //
translated: No, for all the defilements are abandoned at once.

original: de dag gi dral ba'i thob pa yang dang yang /
analyzed: de dag gi dral ba'i thob pa yang dang yang /
translated: By the mere fact of the acquisition of the path of the adept, all the defilements are abandoned.🔽The possession of the defilements is cut off in the future in regard to all the stages.

original: dus du zhig tu zhe na /
analyzed: dus du zhig tu zhe na /
translated: In how many time periods are the defilements abandoned?

original: smras pa / dus drug tu ste /
analyzed: smras pa / dus drug tu ste /
translated: In six time periods:

original: gnyen po skyes dang 'bras thob dang / dbang po rnam par 'phel rnams su //
analyzed: gnyen po skyes dang 'bras thob dang / dbang po rnam par 'phel rnams su //
translated: when the antidote arises, when the effect is acquired, when the faculties are transformed, when one passes to another stage, when one abandons the effect, when one obtains the status of the perfected being.

original: 'di ni gnyen po'i rnam par grol ba'i lam min par bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyen po'i rnam par grol ba'i lam min par bsams pa'o //
translated: This is not the path of liberation through the antidote.

original: 'bras bu dag ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu bzhi'o //
translated: The fruits are the four fruits of the śramaṇa.

original: dbang po rnam par 'phel ba ni dbang po lnga po 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnam par 'phel ba ni dbang po lnga po 'pho ba'o //
translated: The increase of the faculties is the transmutation of the five faculties.

original: dus de dag tu nyon mongs pa'i bral ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: dus de dag tu nyon mongs pa'i bral ba 'thob bo //
translated: One obtains the separation from the defilements at those times.

original: de yang ci rigs par kha cig @255b gis dus drug tu 'thob pa nas kha cig gis ni dus gnyis kyi bar du 'thob par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par kha cig @255b gis dus drug tu 'thob pa nas kha cig gis ni dus gnyis kyi bar du 'thob par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should understand that some obtain it in six times, up to some in two times.

original: bral ba de nyid gnas skabs de dang de dag tu yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo //
analyzed: bral ba de nyid gnas skabs de dang de dag tu yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo //
translated: That very separation obtains the name of complete knowledge in those states.

original: yongs su shes pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two complete knowledges:

original: ye shes kyi yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: complete knowledge through the wisdom and complete knowledge through abandonment.

original: de la ye shes kyi yongs su shes pa ni zag pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes kyi yongs su shes pa ni zag pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Among them, complete knowledge through the wisdom is uncontaminated knowledge.

original: spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa ni spang ba kho na ste /
analyzed: spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa ni spang ba kho na ste /
translated: Complete knowledge through abandonment is just abandonment.

original: 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause is designated as the fruit.

original: ci spangs pa thams cad yongs su shes pa gcig kho na yin nam zhe na ;
analyzed: ci spangs pa thams cad yongs su shes pa gcig kho na yin nam zhe na ;
translated: Is the complete knowledge of all that is to be abandoned only one?

original: smras pa / ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: yongs su shes dgu /
analyzed: yongs su shes dgu /
translated: There are nine complete knowledges.

original: de la re zhig 'dod pa na //
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dod pa na //
translated: First, in the desire realm,🔽one complete knowledge is the abandonment of the two aspects of the first.

original: dang po'i rnam gnyis zad la gcig /'dod pa'i khams na dang po'i rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po'i rnam gnyis zad la gcig /'dod pa'i khams na dang po'i rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In the desire realm, the abandonment of the two aspects of the first truth,

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa gcig yin no //
translated: which are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing the truths of suffering and origin, is one complete knowledge.

original: gnyis zad pa ni de gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis zad pa ni de gnyis so //
translated: Two complete knowledges are the abandonment of the two.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kho na na 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa spangs ba ni yongs su shes pa gcig yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kho na na 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa spangs ba ni yongs su shes pa gcig yin la /
translated: In the desire realm alone, the abandonment of the aspects to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of cessation is one complete knowledge.

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa spangs pa yang gcig yin no//
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa spangs pa yang gcig yin no//
translated: The abandonment of the aspects to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of the path is one complete knowledge.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs ba yongs su shes pa gsum yin pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs ba yongs su shes pa gsum yin pa ltar /
translated: Just as the abandonment of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing in the desire realm is three complete knowledges,

original: de bzhin gong ma'i de gsum nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin gong ma'i de gsum nyid /
translated: so too the higher realms have three.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa spangs pa yang yongs su shes pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa spangs pa yang yongs su shes pa gsum yin te /
translated: Similarly, the abandonment of the aspects of the truths to be abandoned by the path of seeing that pertain to the realms of form and formlessness are also three perfect knowledges.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni gcig yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni gcig yin no //
translated: The abandonment of the truths of suffering and origin that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing is one perfect knowledge.

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni gnyis yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni gnyis yin no //
translated: The abandonment of the truths of cessation that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing is the second perfect knowledge.

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni gsum yin no //
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni gsum yin no //
translated: The abandonment of the truths of path that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing is the third perfect knowledge.

original: de ltar na khams gsum pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa drug yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khams gsum pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa drug yin no //
translated: Thus, the abandonment of the truths to be abandoned by the path of seeing that pertain to the three realms is six perfect knowledges.🔽There are three other perfect knowledges:🔽the abandonment of the factors associated with the lower realms,

original: yongs su shes pa gzhan gsum ste tha ma'i cha dang mthun gzugs dang / zag pa kun zad /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa gzhan gsum ste tha ma'i cha dang mthun gzugs dang / zag pa kun zad /
translated: the abandonment of the form realm,

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa yang /🔽yongs su shes pa gcig @256a * //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa yang / yongs su shes pa gcig @256a * //
translated: and the exhaustion of all contaminants.🔽The abandonment of the factors associated with the lower realms is one perfect knowledge.

original: yin no ; / gzugs kyi zag pa spangs pa yang gcig yin te /
analyzed: yin no ; / gzugs kyi zag pa spangs pa yang gcig yin te /
translated: The abandonment of the contaminants of the form realm is one perfect knowledge.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags zad pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The complete knowledge of the exhaustion of attachment to the realm of fine-materiality.

original: zag pa thams cad spangs pa yang gcig yin te /
analyzed: zag pa thams cad spangs pa yang gcig yin te /
translated: The complete knowledge of the exhaustion of all fluxes is one.

original: kun du sbyor ba thams cad yongs su gtugs pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba thams cad yongs su gtugs pa'i yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The complete knowledge of the exhaustion of all the fetters.

original: ci'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa ni tha dad par bstan la mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams spangs pa'i yongs su shes pa ni tha dad par bstan la mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the complete knowledge of the abandonment of the defilements of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality, which are to be abandoned by cultivation, distinguished, but not the complete knowledge of the abandonment of the defilements of the realm of desire and of the realm of fine-materiality, which are to be abandoned by the path of insight?

original: bsgom pas spong bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po mi 'dra pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bsgom pas spong bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po mi 'dra pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the antidotes to the defilements of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality, which are to be abandoned by cultivation, are not similar.

original: / de ltar na yongs su shes pa ni de dgu yin no //
analyzed: / de ltar na yongs su shes pa ni de dgu yin no //
translated: Thus there are nine complete knowledges.

original: de dag las /
analyzed: de dag las /
translated: Among them,

original: snga ma drug bzod 'bras /
analyzed: snga ma drug bzod 'bras /
translated: the first six are the effect of acceptance.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa'i rang bzhin gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pa'i rang bzhin gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: The complete knowledge of the abandonment of the defilements of the realm of desire which are to be abandoned by the path of insight.

original: lhag ma rnams ni shes pa yis //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni shes pa yis //
translated: The rest are the effect of knowledge.

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa la sogs pa'i yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa spangs pa la sogs pa'i yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: The complete knowledge of the abandonment of the defilements of the realm of fine-materiality which are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, etc.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the effect of the path of cultivation.

original: ji ltar yongs su shes pa bzod pa'i 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su shes pa bzod pa'i 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: How can perfect knowledge be the effect of acceptance?

original: bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because acceptance is the retinue of knowledge,

original: rgyal po'i 'khor la rgyal po nye bar btags pa bzhin pa dang / shes pa dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal po'i 'khor la rgyal po nye bar btags pa bzhin pa dang / shes pa dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: just as the retinue of a king is designated as the king himself, and because it has the same effect as knowledge.

original: mi lcogs med 'bras thams cad do //
analyzed: mi lcogs med 'bras thams cad do //
translated: The effect of the stage of preliminary concentration is all.

original: bsam gtan rnams kyi lnga'am brgyad //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams kyi lnga'am brgyad //
translated: The effect of the absorptions is five or eight.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs kyis ni bsam gtan kyi  dngos gzhi'i 'bras bu yongs su shes pa lnga ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs kyis ni bsam gtan kyi  dngos gzhi'i 'bras bu yongs su shes pa lnga ste /
translated: According to the Vaibhāṣika system, the effect of the actual basis of the absorptions is five perfect knowledges.

original: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa la spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spongs pa'i rang bzhin gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa la spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spongs pa'i rang bzhin gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: They are the perfect knowledges that abandon the afflictions of the form and formless realms.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa rnams ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa rnams ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abandoning the afflictions of the desire realm is the effect of unrestricted access concentration.

original: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi lugs kyis ni brgyad de /
analyzed: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi lugs kyis ni brgyad de /
translated: According to the Bhadanta Ghoṣaka, there are eight.
